info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:52PM CDT until July 01 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PERRY...NORTHWESTERN WILLIAMSON AND WESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 351 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Christopher, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... West Frankfort, Christopher, Sesser, Zeigler, Royalton, Valier, West City, North City, Buckner, Orient and Freeman Spur. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 63 and 69. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
